enumValues.name: FEATURE_FILM
enumValues.description: A feature film is a film (also called a movie, motion picture or just film) with a running time long enough to be considered the principal or sole film to fill a program.

enumValues.name: MEDIUM_LENGTH_FILM
enumValues.description: A medium length film is a film that has a running time of 30 to 59 minutes. In a lot of countries this term is not officially recognized.

enumValues.name: SHORT_FILM
enumValues.description: A short film, is a cinema format, denoting any film not long enough to be considered a feature film.

enumValues.name: TV_MOVIE
enumValues.description: A television film is a feature-length motion picture that is produced for, and originally distributed by or to, a television network, in contrast to theatrical films, which are made explicitly for initial showing in movie theaters.

enumValues.name: SERIAL
enumValues.description: A serial, film serial, movie serial or chapter play, is a motion picture form popular during the first half of the 20th century, consisting of a series of short subjects exhibited in consecutive order at one theater, generally advancing weekly, until the series is completed.

enumValues.name: ANTHOLOGY_FILM
enumValues.description: An anthology film is a subgenre of films consisting of several different short films, often tied together by only a single theme, premise, or brief interlocking event (often a turning point). Sometimes each one is directed by a different director.

enumValues.description: Videos sorted by title in alphabetical order.

enumValues.name: REVERSE_ALPHABETICAL

enumValues.description: Videos sorted by popularity on a monthly basis.

enumValues.name: WEEKLY_POPULARITY
enumValues.description: Videos sorted by popularity on a weekly basis.

enumValues.name: DAILY_POPULARITY
enumValues.description: Videos sorted by popularity on a daily J-1.

enumValues.description: Videos sorted by the selection of cms.

enumValues.description: Videos sorted by rank in ascending order.

enumValues.description: Video sorted by popularity (all time).

enumValues.name: CREDITS
enumValues.description: Credits are a list of the cast and crew of a particular motion picture, television program, or video game.

enumValues.name: ADVERTISING
enumValues.description: Advertising is a video form of marketing communication that employs an openly sponsored, nonpersonal message to promote or sell a product, service or idea.

enumValues.name: TV_PROGRAM
enumValues.description: A tv program is a segment of content intended for broadcast on over-the-air, cable television, or Internet television, other than a commercial, trailer, or any other segment of content not serving as attraction for viewership. It may be a single production, or more commonly, a series of related productions (also called a television show).

enumValues.name: FEATURETTE
enumValues.description: Featurette is a term used in the American film industry to designate a film usually of three reels in length, or about 24–40 minutes in running time, thus longer than a two-reel short subject but shorter than a feature film.

enumValues.name: INTERVIEW
enumValues.description: A video of an interview.

enumValues.name: EXCERPT
enumValues.description: A video excerpt.

enumValues.name: PARODY_MASHUP
enumValues.description: A parody mashup combines multiple pre-existing video sources in a parodic way into a unified video. The video sources usually have no discernible relation with each other.

enumValues.name: TEASER
enumValues.description: Their purpose is less to tell the audience about a movie's content than simply to let them know that the movie is coming up in the near future, and to add to the hype of the upcoming release.

enumValues.name: TRAILER
enumValues.description: A trailer is an advertisement, usually in the form of a brief excerpt or string of excerpts, for a media work.

enumValues.name: VIDEO_CLIP
enumValues.description: Video clips are short clips of video, usually part of a longer recording. The term is also more loosely used to mean any short video less than the length of a traditional television program.

enumValues.name: VIDEO_GAME_TRAILER
enumValues.description: A trailer for a video game.

enumValues.name: ONLINE_USER_REVIEW
enumValues.description: An online user review is a video where a user from the community, gives his feedback and feelings about various topics (movies, tv show, ...).

enumValues.name: MOVIEGOER_REACTIONS
enumValues.description: A video where a moviegoer (a person who goes to the cinema, especially on a regular basis) gives his feedback.

enumValues.name: COMPLETE
enumValues.description: A full movie or a full series episode.

enumValues.name: FIRST_MINUTES
enumValues.description: The first minutes of a movie or a series episode.

enumValues.name: SPECIAL_REPORT
enumValues.description: A video of a report.

enumValues.name: TRAILER_STREAM
enumValues.description: A trailer stream.

enumValues.name: BLU_RAY
enumValues.description: Blu-ray or Blu-ray Disc (BD) is a digital optical disc data storage format. It was designed to supersede the DVD format, in that it is capable of storing high-definition (720p and 1080p) and ultra high-definition video resolution (2160p).

enumValues.name: DVD
enumValues.description: VD (an abbreviation of "digital versatile disc"[4][5] or "digital video disc"[6]) is a digital optical disc storage format invented and developed by Panasonic, Philips, Sony and Toshiba in 1995.

enumValues.name: POSTER
enumValues.description: This represent a poster (a picture) product.

enumValues.name: REPLAY
enumValues.description: Replay services allow the user to watch movie or series in streaming without any subscription.

enumValues.name: SVOD
enumValues.description: Subscription VOD (SVOD) services use a subscription business model, where subscribers are charged a monthly fee to access unlimited programs.

enumValues.name: VOD
enumValues.description: Video on demand (display) (VOD) are systems which allow users to select and watch/listen to video or audio content such as movies and TV shows when they choose to, rather than having to watch at a specific broadcast time.

enumValues.name: TVOD
enumValues.description: Transactional video on demand (TVOD) is a distribution method by which customers pay for each individual piece of video on demand content.

enumValues.name: VODEST
enumValues.description: Video on demand electronic sales through (VODEST) which allow users to buy the video definitively.

enumValues.name: ALPHABETICAL
enumValues.description: Products sorted by title in alphabetical order.

enumValues.name: REVERSE_ALPHABETICAL
enumValues.description: Products sorted by title in reverse alphabetical order.

enumValues.name: LATEST
enumValues.description: Products sorted by release date with the newer products first.

enumValues.name: OLDEST
enumValues.description: Products sorted by release date with the older products first.

types.name: ReviewSentimentFilter
types.description: Filter user reviews by most negative / positive.

enumValues.name: NEGATIVE
enumValues.description: Only shows reviews that says something negative about the content (eg. rating < 2.5).

enumValues.name: POSITIVE
enumValues.description: Only shows reviews that says something positive about the content. (eg. rating >= 2.5)

enumValues.name: BOTH
enumValues.description: Shows all reviews, ignoring if they are positive or negative.

types.name: ReviewRating
types.description: Filter users reviews by one rating.

enumValues.name: ZERO
enumValues.description: Only show reviews for rating equals to 0.5 (O can't be submit).

enumValues.name: ONE
enumValues.description: Only show reviews for rating equals to 1 or 1.5.

enumValues.name: TWO
enumValues.description: Only show reviews for rating equals to 2 or 2.5.

enumValues.name: THREE
enumValues.description: Only show reviews for rating equals to 3 or 3.5.

enumValues.name: FOUR
enumValues.description: Only show reviews for rating equals to 4 or 4.5.

enumValues.name: FIVE
enumValues.description: Only show reviews for rating equals to 5.

enumValues.name: LATEST
enumValues.description: Shows the newest reviews first.

enumValues.name: OLDEST
enumValues.description: Shows the oldest reviews first.

enumValues.name: MOST_POSITIVE
enumValues.description: Shows the reviews with the best rating first.

enumValues.name: MOST_NEGATIVE
enumValues.description: Shows the reviews with the worst rating first.

enumValues.name: MOST_HELPFUL
enumValues.description: Shows the reviews that were the most approved by the community.

enumValues.name: MOST_SUBSCRIBERS
enumValues.description: Show the reviews with the most subscribers for the review's user.

enumValues.name: MOST_REVIEWS
enumValues.description: Show the reviews with the most user which write the more reviews.

types.name: __Schema
types.description: A GraphQL Schema defines the capabilities of a GraphQL server. It exposes all available types and directives on the server, as well as the entry points for query, mutation, and subscription operations.

fields.name: types
fields.description: A list of all types supported by this server.

fields.name: queryType
fields.description: The type that query operations will be rooted at.

fields.name: mutationType
fields.description: If this server supports mutation, the type that mutation operations will be rooted at.

fields.name: subscriptionType
fields.description: If this server support subscription, the type that subscription operations will be rooted at.

fields.name: directives
fields.description: A list of all directives supported by this server.

types.name: __Type
types.description:
The fundamental unit of any GraphQL Schema is the type. There are many kinds of types in GraphQL as represented by the `__TypeKind` enum.

Depending on the kind of a type, certain fields describe information about that type. Scalar types provide no information beyond a name and description, while Enum types provide their values. Object and Interface types provide the fields they describe. Abstract types, Union and Interface, provide the Object types possible at runtime. List and NonNull types compose other types.

types.name: __TypeKind
types.description: An enum describing what kind of type a given `__Type` is.

enumValues.name: SCALAR
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a scalar.

enumValues.name: OBJECT
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an object. `fields` and `interfaces` are valid fields.

enumValues.name: INTERFACE
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an interface. `fields` and `possibleTypes` are valid fields.

enumValues.name: UNION
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a union. `possibleTypes` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: ENUM
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an enum. `enumValues` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: INPUT_OBJECT
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an input object. `inputFields` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: LIST
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a list. `ofType` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: NON_NULL
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a non-null. `ofType` is a valid field.

types.name: __Field
types.description: Object and Interface types are described by a list of Fields, each of which has a name, potentially a list of arguments, and a return type.

types.name: __InputValue
types.description: Arguments provided to Fields or Directives and the input fields of an InputObject are represented as Input Values which describe their type and optionally a default value.

fields.name: defaultValue
fields.description: A GraphQL-formatted string representing the default value for this input value.

types.name: __EnumValue
types.description: One possible value for a given Enum. Enum values are unique values, not a placeholder for a string or numeric value. However an Enum value is returned in a JSON response as a string.

types.name: __Directive
types.description:
A Directive provides a way to describe alternate runtime execution and type validation behavior in a GraphQL document.

In some cases, you need to provide options to alter GraphQL's execution behavior in ways field arguments will not suffice, such as conditionally including or skipping a field. Directives provide this by describing additional information to the executor.

types.name: __DirectiveLocation
types.description: A Directive can be adjacent to many parts of the GraphQL language, a __DirectiveLocation describes one such possible adjacencies.

enumValues.name: QUERY
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a query operation.

enumValues.name: MUTATION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a mutation operation.

enumValues.name: SUBSCRIPTION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a subscription operation.

enumValues.name: FIELD
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a field.

enumValues.name: FRAGMENT_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a fragment definition.

enumValues.name: FRAGMENT_SPREAD
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a fragment spread.

enumValues.name: INLINE_FRAGMENT
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an inline fragment.

enumValues.name: SCHEMA
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a schema definition.

enumValues.name: SCALAR
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a scalar definition.

enumValues.name: OBJECT
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an object type definition.

enumValues.name: FIELD_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a field definition.

enumValues.name: ARGUMENT_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an argument definition.

enumValues.name: INTERFACE
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an interface definition.

enumValues.name: UNION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a union definition.

enumValues.name: ENUM
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an enum definition.

enumValues.name: ENUM_VALUE
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an enum value definition.

enumValues.name: INPUT_OBJECT
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an input object type definition.

enumValues.name: INPUT_FIELD_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an input object field definition.
